claim: An ammonia fighting cleaner is good for pet owners.

supporting.text: Ammonia-based cleaners effectively neutralize pet urine odors, which are a common issue for pet owners.

attacks.text: Ammonia-based cleaners effectively neutralize pet urine odors, which are a common issue for pet owners.
Ammonia in cleaners can mimic the smell of urine, potentially encouraging pets to re-soil the same area.
Proper cleaning techniques and enzyme-based cleaners can eliminate odors without the risk of attracting pets back to the spot.
Ammonia fumes can be harmful to pets, especially birds and small animals, causing respiratory issues.
Ventilating the area and using ammonia cleaners in moderation can mitigate risks to pets.

supporting.text: These cleaners break down organic stains from pets, making them easier to remove from surfaces.

attacks.text: These cleaners break down organic stains from pets, making them easier to remove from surfaces.
Ammonia-based cleaners can be toxic to pets if ingested or inhaled, posing a health risk.
Modern ammonia cleaners are often formulated with pet-safe additives to reduce toxicity.
Organic stains can often be removed effectively with non-toxic alternatives like enzyme-based cleaners.
Enzyme-based cleaners may take longer to work compared to ammonia-based cleaners, reducing convenience.

supporting.text: Ammonia is a strong disinfectant, reducing the risk of bacterial contamination from pet waste.

attacks.text: Ammonia is a strong disinfectant, reducing the risk of bacterial contamination from pet waste.
Ammonia fumes can be harmful to pets, causing respiratory irritation or other health issues.
Proper ventilation and dilution of ammonia cleaners can mitigate risks to pets while maintaining disinfectant properties.
Many pet-safe disinfectants (e.g., enzymatic cleaners) are equally effective without ammonia's toxicity.
Ammonia-based cleaners are often more affordable and widely available than specialized pet-safe alternatives.

supporting.text: Using ammonia-based cleaners can deter pets from re-soiling the same area due to its strong odor.

attacks.text: Using ammonia-based cleaners can deter pets from re-soiling the same area due to its strong odor.
Ammonia's odor resembles urine, which may attract pets to mark the area again rather than deter them.
Many pets are deterred by strong odors, including ammonia, reducing the likelihood of re-soiling.
Ammonia fumes can be harmful to pets, causing respiratory irritation or other health issues.
Proper ventilation and diluted use of ammonia-based cleaners minimize health risks to pets.

supporting.text: Many ammonia-based cleaners are affordable and widely available, making them accessible to pet owners.

attacks.text: Many ammonia-based cleaners are affordable and widely available, making them accessible to pet owners.
Ammonia fumes can be harmful to pets, especially birds and small animals, despite the affordability and availability of these cleaners.
Proper ventilation and dilution can mitigate the risks of ammonia fumes, making these cleaners safe for use around pets when used correctly.
Many pet owners are unaware of the proper dilution ratios and ventilation requirements, increasing the risk of harm to their pets.
Educational campaigns and clear labeling on ammonia-based cleaners can inform pet owners about safe usage practices.

supporting.text: Properly diluted ammonia solutions are safe for use on non-porous surfaces commonly found in homes with pets.

attacks.text: Properly diluted ammonia solutions are safe for use on non-porous surfaces commonly found in homes with pets.
Ammonia fumes can be harmful to pets, especially birds and small animals, even when diluted.
Proper ventilation and following dilution guidelines minimize the risk of ammonia fumes harming pets.
Pets may lick or come into contact with surfaces cleaned with ammonia, leading to potential ingestion of harmful residues.
Thorough rinsing and drying of surfaces after cleaning with ammonia can prevent pets from ingesting residues.
